description:
There’s a long history to text markup languages, and I don’t think most
people know much of it. This talk gives a quick overview of the major
formats, including nroff/troff, SGML, HTML, Docbook, TeX and LaTeX,
setext, reStructuredText, markdown and AsciiDoc.

In passing, I shall complain briefly about the history of wiki markups,
and explain my reservations about markdown, and why it’s still a good
thing.

The slides, and extended notes, will be available at
https://github.com/tibs/markup-history.
title: A brief history of text markup languages
